messages.subject: RE: [Unschooling-dotcom] deschooling reading
messages.msgSnippet: Thanks, I will look it up.  Things are doing a lot better and we are evening out here.  I started to noticed where my kids were really at in their development
messages.messageBody:
Thanks, I will look it up. Things are doing a lot better and we are
evening out here. I started to noticed where my kids were really at in
their development something I could not do when Nate was in school. And
now I have dropped the overbearing of academics and the days are lots
soother. I also got the book, "Math Wizardry for Kids" and we are both
enthusiastic about it. Lisa

-----Original Message-----
From: Kelli Traaseth [mailto:kellitraas@...]
Sent: Friday, September 20, 2002 7:35 AM
To: Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com
Subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] deschooling reading


David Gutterson's Family Matters: Why Homeschooling Makes Sense
As I was reading this, I would have ahaa moments that I would share with
my husband. He seemed to really relate to him, and the author is a
teacher. So that's a great perspective. Very realistic, in terms of the
masses. I was able to check it out at my library. I don't know if it
really is on deschooling but it really was great for my husband.
Kelli T
mabeitzel wrote: I need some good reading material for my husband so
that he may
better understand what and why we are doing (deschooling right
now). He does much better when left to read and find out for
himself...hmm.
Any suggestions
Michelle Beitzel
